intro: Cyphostemma sakalavense, commonly known as the Madagascar moonvine, is a climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
